story:
tʰu̟ - phonetic for "two" - it addresses the #two basic human need after food/water, our shelters will be on site no later than day two after disaster strikes, it takes two people to set up in under two minutes, and it provides shelter for two adults. Further, we're aiming to keep the unit weight under 200 pounds and cost well below $2k m (free of charge through NPO).

 

Check out our podcast interview with Jonathan Nadeau: http://crowdfundingcast.tk/crowdfunding-cast-ep... 

 

No camping in disaster zones!

Haiti, Gatlinburg, Louisiana - in crisis, our most basic need after food is shelter - not a tent, and not a bulky trailer weeks after the fact.

tʰu̟ shelters will instantly protect humans from the elements. tʰu̟ is easily deployable to nearby and remote areas of the world - after floods, earthquakes, hurricanes, tornadoes, wildfires.

tʰu̟ is designed to bridge the first critical hours and days before emergency services can organize large scale camps, organize relief and relocation efforts.

 

 

#1: Mobility

Emergency shelters must be highly mobile - collapsible, light weight, fit any truck or aircraft to enable quick deployment to disaster zones. Advancing fires, receding flood waters? Just pull tʰu̟ to where you need it - by hand, by horse, by ATV

 

#2: Stability

 tʰu̟ shelters are solid, safe, fireproof. No comparison to a tent, our shelters safeguard first responders and victims of natural disasters from debris, water, mud, rodents, predators. They do not require tools or stakes and can be set up in stormy and low-light conditions in catastrophe epicenters

 

#3: Simplicity

Humans who lost everything do not ask for ZigBee connections and air conditioning - they need a safe, dry shelter.

Low complexity construction means less cost and better durability.  tʰu̟ shelters are made of 10 main components. It takes two persons less than two minutes to fold up our shelter, no tools or assembly instructions needed.

 

Concept

The shelter sports two fold-out bunk beds. All moving parts are hinged, which keeps complexity to a minimum.

Front and back walls keep the folding side walls upright (walls lock into place). The even-sided operation and ease of setup is supported by springs in the floor section.

The design maximizes space to about 45 sf per unit.

A single tractor trailer will carry about stacked 35 units (shelter for 70).

 

Funding

We’ll need funding to advance development and prototyping.

tʰu̟ contributions are non-deductible at this time.

Manufacturing requires a commercial structure due to tremendous cost of molds.

We will launch a non-profit organization for deployment to disaster zones, and to make the units available to aid organizations at little or no cost.

 

In case our Indiegogo funds don't permit us to support the project, 100% of unused funds will go to a non-profit disaster relief organization like Team Rubicon.

 

The Mission

Our goal is to make loads of low-cost, safe shelters available to humans in need within hours.

Our campaign will spend up to 6 months engineering, sourcing and testing before we hit the ground running with mass production.

 

The Path

It’s fairly simple and straight forward – our shelter will consist of a minimum number of parts, seals, technology. We’ll make use of basic physics and mechanics. No tools will be needed to set up a unit - it stabilizes and supports itself.

We will engineer and test based on UN- and Milspec standards to exceed international code requirements.
story_txt: tʰu̟ - phonetic for "two" - it addresses the #two basic human need after food/water, our shelters will be on site no later than day two after disaster strikes, it takes two people to set up in under two minutes, and it provides shelter for two adults. Further, we're aiming to keep the unit weight under 200 pounds and cost well below $2k m (free of charge through NPO). Check out our podcast interview with Jonathan Nadeau: http://crowdfundingcast.tk/crowdfunding-cast-ep...  No camping in disaster zones!Haiti, Gatlinburg, Louisiana - in crisis, our most basic need after food is shelter - not a tent, and not a bulky trailer weeks after the fact.tʰu̟ shelters will instantly protect humans from the elements. tʰu̟ is easily deployable to nearby and remote areas of the world - after floods, earthquakes, hurricanes, tornadoes, wildfires.tʰu̟ is designed to bridge the first critical hours and days before emergency services can organize large scale camps, organize relief and relocation efforts.  #1: MobilityEmergency shelters must be highly mobile - collapsible, light weight, fit any truck or aircraft to enable quick deployment to disaster zones. Advancing fires, receding flood waters? Just pull tʰu̟ to where you need it - by hand, by horse, by ATV #2: Stability tʰu̟ shelters are solid, safe, fireproof. No comparison to a tent, our shelters safeguard first responders and victims of natural disasters from debris, water, mud, rodents, predators. They do not require tools or stakes and can be set up in stormy and low-light conditions in catastrophe epicenters #3: SimplicityHumans who lost everything do not ask for ZigBee connections and air conditioning - they need a safe, dry shelter.Low complexity construction means less cost and better durability.  tʰu̟ shelters are made of 10 main components. It takes two persons less than two minutes to fold up our shelter, no tools or assembly instructions needed. ConceptThe shelter sports two fold-out bunk beds. All moving parts are hinged, which keeps complexity to a minimum.Front and back walls keep the folding side walls upright (walls lock into place). The even-sided operation and ease of setup is supported by springs in the floor section.The design maximizes space to about 45 sf per unit.A single tractor trailer will carry about stacked 35 units (shelter for 70). FundingWe’ll need funding to advance development and prototyping.tʰu̟ contributions are non-deductible at this time.Manufacturing requires a commercial structure due to tremendous cost of molds.We will launch a non-profit organization for deployment to disaster zones, and to make the units available to aid organizations at little or no cost. In case our Indiegogo funds don't permit us to support the project, 100% of unused funds will go to a non-profit disaster relief organization like Team Rubicon. The MissionOur goal is to make loads of low-cost, safe shelters available to humans in need within hours.Our campaign will spend up to 6 months engineering, sourcing and testing before we hit the ground running with mass production. The PathIt’s fairly simple and straight forward – our shelter will consist of a minimum number of parts, seals, technology. We’ll make use of basic physics and mechanics. No tools will be needed to set up a unit - it stabilizes and supports itself.We will engineer and test based on UN- and Milspec standards to exceed international code requirements.

story:
Another Effective Way to Combat Superbugs!

It has been 9 months passed since Mars and Dat Ly started working on this project. Both of them are very passionate, critical, and excited about this new endeavor.

It started one spring morning in March 2016, while Dat Ly was telling a story how most men do not their hands after they urinate according to CDC. Laughter filled the room. Mars stated, we need to find a solution to this jokingly. Both Dat Ly and Mars came up with ideas after ideas, and more ideas and until it was upgraded to now what is called Buto.  Buto is a hand tool for males that is used to protect the hand while urinating. It is a water dissolvable plastic, easy to use, after usage you toss it into the toilet, and no addition to the landfill. This will create a lifestyle change with men's health and sanitation.

Mars and Dat Ly's ideas did not stop there, it continued to grow. And of course because of Buto, it gave birth to TP (Tissue + Plastic), TP is a tissue paper with a polymer backing, both men and women will use for whatever multiple purposes. TP will prevent breakage and wetting after wiping with urine, fecal mater, phlegm, and other bodily fluids that are infectious. In the near future it will come in different sizes, wet or dry, and also will come both biodegradable and water dissolvable. Isn't it exciting!

The following are the goals of Matinee Products (Buto and TP):

To PREVENT spread of bugs and superbugs.  

To improve CLEANLINESS in bathrooms.                                                                                                        

To provide an eco-friendly products, because it is WATER DISSOLVABLE/BIODEGRADABLE and will not add to landfill.                                                                                                                            

Water efficent.                                                                                                                                                    

COST EFFECTIVE, especially with TP.                                                                                                            

To provide TIME EFFICIENT and safe use of bathrooms and portable bathrooms.                          

To protect hand during urination.                                                                                                            

Protect the hand from tissue breakage because it has polymer backing, increasing men's and women's protection.

Matinee LLC was formed on July 19, 2016, prior to that they were working side by side to get ready on how to patent: Buto and TP. Research was intensively done; sleepless nights with running and wondering minds was the game. Blasting and non-stop burning of mind energy. There is a reason to be excited! Matinee is happy to say that both Buto and TP are Patent Pending status. How awesome is that!

The Founders  would like to share their smiles and excitement because of these new and innovative products. Both of them are in the healthcare professions and has saw spread and effects of infections to the human body and the direct and indirect effects to the community and country as a whole.

It is not fun. Please see links : http://www.healio.com/infectious-disease/news/o...

https://www.niaid.nih.gov/diseases-conditions/i...

https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2016/p1006-c...

http://www.phac-aspc.gc.ca/id-mi/inf-cont-inf/s...

Prototyping of products was done, it was pretty cool.

In any start up business there are challenges that a company would conquer and overcome. These challenges are introducing a new yet innovative products, marketing challenges, finding the right people to work on the product, production itself, fulfilling the demand, and last one and most important is the funding to start the project rolling.
Matinee already did an intensive research on our product itself, marketing strategies, finding the right people, production, how to fulfill demand but right now, they need help with funding this project.

If you think that health is wealth, then we are in the same page. 

Matinee is here to create the Lifestyle change to the changing world. 

We need funding for the machines, raw materials, campaign/marketing fees, and other labor costs. Now, this is the moment of truth. MATINEE, Mars and Dat Ly needs your BIG HELP to be able to realize this project.

story:
Hello,

My name is Jonas and I have been dealing with dry scalp and dandruff since I was 12 years old. The regular OTC brands like selsun blue, head and shoulders etc. never really worked for me.  A couple of years ago I was a recommended a more homeopathic treatment that actually worked at getting rid of my flakes and I would combine it with Selsun Blue.  The treatment smells and you need to reapply every 3 weeks.  I thought too bad there isn't just a daily shampoo that has all of the good and none of the bad.  

I decided to make my own shampoo in a blender that would have all the ingredients I want.  Once I got the shampoo to 100% I went to a lab to make a mass producible version so that I could streamline the costs and make a version that could price to market.

Benefits of my shampoo include:

  • Sulfate Free
  • Paraben Free
  • Fragrance Free
  • No Artificial Coloring

I also use an organic cleanser and organic aloe mixed with cocoa butter material for moisturizing the scalp.
